title: Andy's Play
description: Andy invites the entire office to watch him in the community theater production of "Sweeney Todd," but Erin decides to babysit for Jim and Pam instead, and Michael is upset because he auditioned for the lead and didn't get it.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Andy? [Andy starts boombox and begins singing 'The Ballad of Sweeney Todd']

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes! [as other costumed actors come in and join Andy in song]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Did you write this?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Who did?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Steven Sondheim.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Who is he? [rest of Sweeney Todd cast enters and continues singing]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: What the hell is happening?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: We're the cast of Sweeney Todd:

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [cheers loudly after cast finishes singing song] That was amazing! That was awesome! I auditioned for this. When did the cast list go up?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Like a month ago.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really? They didn't call me. Who am I playing? ...Andy?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Two comps. For my lady and her Gabe. It's closing night. Tomorrow we have to give the theater over to the Scranton's Miss Fitness pageant.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I am so excited. But I just need one. Gabe can't come. Sorry.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What? That's awful. Everyone's gonna miss that guy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Gabe is not coming, which is huge because my plan is to make Erin fall back in love with me tonight. Women cannot resist a man singing show tunes. It's so powerful, even a lot of men can't resist a man singing show tunes.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh, who else is going?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Everyone.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Gabe seemed to think no one was going.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What kind of terrible rumor monger is Gabe? He is woefully misinformed, all right? Excuse me, clink, clink, clink, clink, everybody. You're all coming to my show tonight, right?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Andy, what time's the show?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: 8pm sharp.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How long is it?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hour forty-five.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nope, can't make it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: They say that no one can take your pride, but the people who cast Andy's play, they took mine.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Jim, Pam, you guys are in, right?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, we wanted to, but our sitter just fell through. I'm really sorry.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uh, no, thank you. Last time I went to the theater, a man dressed as a cat sat on my lap.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: It would mean so much to me if you came to my show tonight.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I can't Andy, it's too hard. That's-I put everything I had into that audition. Do you understand that?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: If it makes you feel any better, no one who auditioned for the part of Sweeney Todd got that part. They had to bring in a ringer.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: This guy's like world-class. You should not feel bad. I'm asking you thespian to thespian. Will you please be the bigger man and come to my show?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I wish I could, Andy, but I can't. I have plans that night. I'm going to see a friend in a play called Sweeney Todd. You're that friend. I'm going to see your play.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Noishe!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And scene.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Listen, I would like you to take me to Andy's play tonight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Please, waste of time. You know what? Let's just knock this out right now. Disrobe.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Angela? Don't like her anymore. Not attracted to her anymore. Just contractually obligated to make a baby with her.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Give me the punch card.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No. If you want to punch the punch card, you have to take me to the show.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That is not in the contract.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Well, there's a lot of gray area in that clause.  Do you want to re-mediate?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Alright, fine. I'll go to your little show, but I'm not wearing a cape.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Dwight and I have a contractual agreement to procreate five times, plain and simple. And should he develop feelings for me, well, that would be permissible under item 7C, clause 2, so I would not object. [faint smile]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey, how are those salads?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It's my own fault-

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: My parents used to scramble to find babysitters so they could take my younger brother to do stuff. I understand how hard it can be. I just-tonight, if you could...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We'll keep looking.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I mean, who knows? Maybe I have a niece my family never told me about.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh my gosh, that would be amazing.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: For a lot of reasons.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, I know. Neiche!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, hey guys.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: You brought balloons to a play?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I did, because I am being the bigger man, and balloons are bigger than flowers.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: It's nice, like Up.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Usher
quotes.text: Excuse me, are you the guy who did an entire Law & Order episode for his audition?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nope.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Guys?

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.text: Hey! Andy!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You all made it, thank you so much.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You should actually thank Erin, she's the one who agreed to babysit.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: She's babysitting?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I really wanted to see Andy's play, because he's so, so talented. But I've been trying to get in the babysitting game forever. The thirteen-year-olds in this town have a complete monopoly. It's almost like a babysitters club.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I understand. This is, like, huge opportunity for her.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [trying to stuff balloons below the seats] This is ridiculous. You'd think they'd discourage people from bringing in balloons.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Hey, I think this guy playing Sweeney Todd is my plumber.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, Darryl. This guy's a world-class actor. He doesn't daylight as your plumber.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: No, it's my plumber. Says so in his bio. Apparently the director discovered him doing karaoke. It's his first play. He didn't even audition.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Are you kidding me?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Shhh. If we don't listen to the overture, we won't recognize the musical themes when they come back later.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right, I'm sorry. God.

quotes.speaker: Usher
quotes.text: Excuse me, I think you may be in the wrong seats. [Jim and Pam move a few rows back, next to Michael]

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Ooooh!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [whispering to man sitting beside him] I work with that guy.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [after taking her gum out] Ugh! There's gum on the seat and now it's on my work skirt. I have to go change.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Too bad I'm not gonna explain anything that you miss.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Oh, Dwight, just move.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [whispering to man sitting beside him] His name's Andy. He's a terrible salesman.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: What time is it? [Ryan pulls up a large analog clock on his iPad]

quotes.speaker: Shelby
quotes.text: Michael! Shelby Thomas Weemes, the director.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hello.

quotes.speaker: Shelby
quotes.text: I promise you that if you keep auditioning with similar gusto...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Shelby
quotes.text: We are going to find a production with a role for Michael Scott.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Shelby
quotes.text: Yes?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Shelby
quotes.text: Good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good.

quotes.speaker: Shelby
quotes.text: Enjoy the second act.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You enjoy the second act.

quotes.speaker: Shelby
quotes.text: Have a refreshment.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you. You, too. [steals a bottle of wine from the bar]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Come on, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Why are you dressed like a seed catalogue model?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: These are just my dirty old gardening clothes. They were all that I had in my car.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Let's go.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, Erin, it's Pam. How ya doing? No, no, don't put Cece on the phone, because she can't talk yet. Okay. No, I was just calling to see how everything's going. Yeah? Yeah? It's good? The play? The play is kind of great. I mean, it's fun to hear Andy sing in the appropriate setting. Now, he's really sorry you couldn't make it, too. Yeah. So thank you so much, again. We're having a great time. Oh, they're flashing the lights so we should go in. Thanks. Bye. Okay, so we called. And everything's fine!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Everything's fine.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We can relax.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: We can relax. Let's get our Sweeney on.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: [seeing Michael drink from wine bottle] Michael! [bottle gets passed around by Darryl, Meredith and Kevin]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Just checking my e-mails. See if I got any last-minute "break a legs" or "I still love you" type texts. Doesn't look like I got anything.  Maybe on my Facebook wall.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: [on cell phone] Unfortunately, in this ham-fisted production of Sweeney Todd, the real terror comes from the vocal performances. New paragraph.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Mr. Todd! Mr. Todd! I found her!

quotes.speaker: Sweeney Todd
quotes.text: You found Johanna.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That monster of a judge has locked her-[cell phone chiming]. Locked her away. [phone continues ringing]

quotes.speaker: Sweeney Todd
quotes.text: There's a little bird fluttering around.  Do hope it ceases chirping. [audience laughs]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How is that funny?

quotes.speaker: Sweeney Todd
quotes.text: The bird continues to call. Someone please turn off your... bird. Oh, for the love-turn your phone off! There are signs!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, it appears the bird was in mine own pocket this whole time. He's gone to sleep now, I've closed his beak. [Michael laughs]

quotes.speaker: Sweeney Todd
quotes.text: What is the news of my darling daughter Johanna?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [text message chime] You know what? Let me just double check, that bird... Okay, good. It's off. I mean, silenced. I silenced it by killing it. I've killed it! I'm a murderer! Just like you, Sweeney Todd. See, it all connects. Not that I know you're a murderer. My character doesn't know that yet. But I'm suspicious, because of all the razors that you have laying around. And you spend time alone. But you're a barber, so that's legit. So there's that. But...

quotes.speaker: Sweeney Todd
quotes.text: [yelling] Where is Johanna?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: A madhouse.

quotes.speaker: Sweeney Todd
quotes.text: A madhouse?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yes, a madhouse.

quotes.speaker: Sweeney Todd
quotes.text: A madhouse? Johanna is as good as rescued. Where do you suppose all the wig makes of London go to obtain their human hair? [Michael tips over wine bottle, which noisily rolls down the theater, and accidentally lets go of balloons]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Do you think... [bottle rolling] so you think... [bottle rolling, clanking]

quotes.speaker: Sweeney Todd
quotes.text: Fogg's Asylum , why not? [balloon pops, Kelly screams and baby starts crying]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sounds like Cece.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, I think everybody just needs to relax.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [sees Erin holding Cece] Oh, my God! Go, go!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, my God.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [excited] That's really irresponsible of Erin. She's a terrible babysitter.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I just didn't think that you guys were gonna see us. We were just gonna stop by and get some ice cream and then go home.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, this was pretty simple-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Why are you here?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [overlapping with Pam] Really, all you had to do was play with her for, like, 30 minutes and then put her to bed.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What possible explanation could you have for possibly being here? I don't... you know, babies shouldn't have ice cream, by the way.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I'm sorry. I just really wanted to see Andy. You guys made it sound so unmissable, and you set me up with a car seat and everything.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, the car seat was to take her to the hospital, or...

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh, no, why would I take her to the hospital?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You know what? It doesn't matter. It doesn't matter.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Why don't I just take her home and let you guys finish, and then you should stay out as late as you want.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, we're good. Thank you, though.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Okay. Alright, bye Cece.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Alright, well, we're never leaving the house again.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Not together!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [during curtain call for Sweeney Todd] Boo! Boo!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: That was more horrifying than Nunsense.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: All that singing got in the way of some perfectly good murders.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Where's my car? Come on.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mmm! Fruit is so much better when it's dried. I've already eaten, like, 30 apricots.

quotes.speaker: Sweeney Todd
quotes.text: Darryl?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Hey!

quotes.speaker: Sweeney Todd
quotes.text: Didn't know you were gonna be here. How's the toilet?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Silent. Look, congratulations.

quotes.speaker: Sweeney Todd
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I had no idea. This plumber has pipes!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, good job. Well done.

quotes.speaker: Sweeney Todd
quotes.text: You're the guy who booed me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hmm? No, there were a lot of people booing you. I wasn't one of em.

quotes.speaker: Sweeney Todd
quotes.text: No, I saw you, and you were the only one.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Get your eyes checked, chucklehead.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Be cool, Michael. I saw this guy kill a bunch of people. Good work.

quotes.speaker: Sweeney Todd
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: You didn't have to boo him.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, he was getting a lot of applause, and I just didn't think it was indicative of how people were really feeling.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: How would you like it if we booed you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That would never happen.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Boo! Boo!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. I appreciate the feedback.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Boo! Boo!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't like that at all.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Are you ready?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yes. Oh, I'm so scared! Okay, kill me! Just kill me! Kill me!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [pretends to slit her throat] Ah! Blood everywhere.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh, no. I'm so glad we're hanging out again outside of work.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, me, too.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Okay, I kill you now.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: All right, let's do this.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No, actually, Dwight, I didn't realize how far this walk was, and I-I'm exhausted.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's okay, I smell.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No, no, no, no. I think I just want to go home, but it's okay. This can count as one of your times.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, no, no. Contractually we're obligated to have sex.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Well, I won't tell if you don't.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I will tell. I will tell the mediator. What-what are you... [Angela reaches into his pocket] Ok. Oh, was that in the way? Get rid of it. [Angela pulls out hole-punch and punches the card]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Good night, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Good night.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: These would have been your seats. Best seats in the house. Lots of people think it would be the front row, but actually, right here, this is where the speakers converge, and the sound just, like, nails you right here.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: This is awesome. [cell phone rings] Sorry. Hi, Gabe. Yeah, I just stopped by Andy's cast party to say hi to everyone. Oh, sure, I can pick you up some soup. What do you want? That's broth, Gabe. Okay, I-I'll see you soup. [hangs up] Okay, I have to go. Thank you so much. This is so much fun, and I'm really sorry that I missed your play, but next time I'll be there. Or here. Right here, I promise.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Awesome.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: See you later.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [attempting to move car seat] It's like The Hurt Locker!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: This night was a disaster.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, it was not a disaster. It was weird, but it wasn't a disaster. I think we have, like, a gift bottle of Irish cream.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: We could put that in orange juice.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Get it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Let's get our juice on.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Found him!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, what's going on here? Post-show blues?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, I guess you could say that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, I get those every day after work.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Your show was really great, Andy.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Interesting subject matter. I'm surprised you pulled it off.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: It was like amateur hour.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: It was an amateur production, technically.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oscar. Enough with the sass, please. God! What is wrong with you? Andy, listen to me. Look me in the eye. I thought that you were awesome.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Stop just saying that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am not just saying that. You can trust that I am telling you the truth. I booed someone tonight. I have no filter. And if I thought you were terrible, I would have booed. And if I thought you had done a better job, I would be saying nicer things right now. But I thought that you were exactly awesome. No better, no worse.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Thank you. That feels good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I did not say that to make you feel good. I just said it. Total integrity.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Andy, sing us another song.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Thanks, but I feel like a loner right now.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Oh, come on, Andy, you were the highlight.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Come on, Andy, seriously.

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.text: Andy! Andy! Andy! Andy! Andy!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Okay, all right, all right, all right.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [sings Macy Gray's "I Try" and everyone joins in]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: In the criminal justice system, the people are defended by two separate but equally important groups, the police who investigate the crimes and the district attorneys who prosecute the offenders. These are their stories. Kun-kun! [imitates vacuum cleaner] I'm just a cleaning lady. Aah! A dead body. He wrapped his belt around his own neck. It looks like a classic case of autoerotic asphyxiation. Yeah, looks like everyone's tightening their belts in this economy. [humming theme music] Last time you saw the victim, was he happy? Last time I saw this John, he was-he wasn't a victim, if you know what I'm talkin about.

quotes.speaker: Shelby
quotes.text: Thanks you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, that was- I'm just getting into the first act.
